result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary A. Shegonee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any commitment time would be consecutive to any jail time that the defendant may be serving.

Huber and good time allowed.
Concurrent with: Jail time on 20CM228, 20CT81 and 21CM09

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar type meeting per week.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol or THC - even if THC is legal in the jurisdiction that she may be in, no entry into any taverns or bars

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: 3:00 PM Defendant appears in person with Attorney Dylan Resch. Alex Seifert appears in person. ADA Seifert- Reached a resolution. Pleading guilty 22CF25 count 3 and 4 guilty as alleged and amended count 5. Remaining counts Dismissed and read in. 21CF146 pleading guilty counts 1, 2 and 3 as alleged. Amended count 5. Count 4, 6, 7, 8 and 9 Dismissed and read in. 21CM09 pleading guilty counts 1, 2 and 4 as alleged. Amended count 3. Count 5 and 6 dismissed and read in. 20CM228 guilty to count 1 as alleged and count 2. 20TR1138 Sate moves to dismiss. 20CT81 pleading guilty to count 1 as alleged. Ct- goes over colloquy with defendant. 22CM28 amended to bail jumping to ordinance, plead guilty. 21CM09 motion of state count 3 amended contrary. Count 3 as amended plead guilty. 21CM39 count 5 and 6 dismissed and read in. 20TR1138 dismissed. 21CF146 motion of state count 4,6,7,8 and 9 dismissed and read in. 21CF146 motion of state count 5 amended contrary to Forest County ordinance, pled guilty. 22CF25 motion of state count 1, 2,6 and 7 dismissed and read in. count 5 amended contrary to Forest County ordinance, plead guilty. Ct- finds Defendant guilty of each count amended plead guilty. Court will find guilty. Joint recommendation. ADA Seifert- $1,000 fine plus court costs. Attny Resch- $1,000 for all cases except for count 2 in 20CM228, $500 forfeiture in costs. Ct- upon joint agreement forfeiture $1,000 plus cost 21CM09 on count 3, 21CM146 $1,000 plus cost. 22CF25 $1,000 plus cost. 20CM28 $500 plus cost. 60 days to pay.  Incarceration be consecutive. 20CM228 $250 be applied to forfeiture posted. 22CM29 $1,000 applied to count 3. 22CM146 $250 applied to count 5. Case 22CF25 $2,000 posted applied to count 5. If some left, go to cost. 20CM228 plead guilty to count 1. 21CM09 count 1 guilty. Count 2 guilty. Plead guilty to count 4. 21CF14 count 1 guilty. Count 2 guilty. Count 3 guilty. 20CT81 count 1 guilty. Case 22CF25 count 3 guilty. Count 4 guilty. Ct- goes over colloquy with defendant. Court finds defendant enters pleas freely, voluntarily and intelligently to pleading guilty and waiving rights. Court will find enters pleas and waives constitutional rights freely voluntarily and conclude in fact guilty to which pleaded. Accept pleas 22CM28 guilty as alleged to count 1. 21CM09 guilty alleged to count 1. Alleged count 2. Possession count 4 as alleged. 21CF146 guilty of count 2 count 3. 20CT81 guilty count 1. 22CF25 guilty count 3, and count 4. ADA Seifert- state recommend as 22CF25 count 4 withheld sentence probation 3 years Court cost only. Condition of probation 180 conditional jail. Conditions of probation AODA follow-through recommendation. Psychological mental health evaluation. Absolute sobriety no alcohol or marijuana. No bars or tavern. Full time employment. Take all medications as prescribed and as directed. 2 weekly groups as period of probation. Misdemeanors, court cost only. States recommendation basis. 180 conditional jail is appropriate. Supervision is appropriate. Attny Resch- county 4 agreement 3 years sentence probation and court cost. Has 170 days credit already felony 22CF25 130 alone. Together ultimately sat significant time already. Voluntarily entered treatment inpatient and intensive outpatient. Applied for retail positions. Maintained absolute sobriety since revocation in June. Currently 7 weeks pregnant. DMV asked to apply for occupations license if court does not object. Defendant- Makes statement. Ct- Considered statement of counsel and defendant. Accepted responsibility. 21Cf146 count 1, 2 and 3 cost only. 20CT81 5 days in jail plus cost. 21CM09 count 1 cost, count 2 40 days in jail and cost. Count 4 cost only. 20CM28 count 1, 5 days in jail plus cost. 22CF25 count 3, 30 days in jail plus cost. Count 4 withhold sentence probation 3 years. Conditions of probation be AODA assessment follow through all recommendations. No need to psych evaluation. Not to consume or possess alcohol no bar or tavern. Not consume or possess marijuana. Full time job and continue to look for job until she gets one. Apply to 3 jobs each week and written report with probation officers. At least one AA or NA or similar program each week during term of probation. No jail as condition of probation. 20CM28 credit 2 day free conviction incarceration. 21CM09 credit for 28 days pre conviction incarceration. 20CT81 credit for 1 day pre conviction. All sentences are concurrent. Cannot vote, no possession of fire arm. DNA sample for each of the counts. Each case. 60 days to pay fines. 23 days to serve with credit and good time applied. Give defendant until Monday 8:30 am to report to jail. adj 4:05 PM

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mary A. Shegonee appeared by video, in custody from Nova Counseling.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Dylan J Resch appeared by video for Mary A. Shegonee. Attorney Dylan J Resch appeared by video for Mary A. Shegonee. Court - here for a bond hearing, poster Hartford Shegonee, is asking for his money back. Shegonee states that he will keep bond in the case if it will help her. Shegonee makes statement as it relates to the bond. Attorney Resch agrees with hat Shegonee states. Mr. Shegonee no longer wants his bond money back, bond remains in effect at $2,000.00 cash that is posted. Resch -  matter needs to be set for JT, does not anticipate it going to trial though.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel

11:22 AM Defendant Mary A. Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Mary A. Shegonee in custody and appears via video Zoom from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mary A. Shegonee appeared by video means with Attorney. Attorney Cveykus appears in person. State calls Detective Sergeant Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 11:23 AM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (11:28 AM). Cross exam by Cveykus at 11:29 AM. Re-direct by State at 11:33 AM. Re-cross by Cveykus (11:33 AM). Robinson excused at 11:34 AM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial, Information has been filed. Cveykus will waive reading of Information, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for JT.
and Certificate of Appearance - TR

10:12 AM Defendant Mary A. Shegonee in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mary A. Shegonee appeared by video means from FOSO. State has just filed the complaint today. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Shegonee understands charges and penalties, has been working on hiring her own attorney, is also on a PO hold. Court continues bond, confirms address and phone number (states she is going to try to get into treatment). Court sets for AIA on 3/23/22 at 9:45 AM.
